Posts.Title: Surgeons in philly duff0015 shrink

Posts.Content: duff0015 wrote: Where does it usually go to first?  I know cancer is often unpredictable but I know they say hormone negative often goes to soft tissue.   Being paranoid again and wondering.  My mid-section is growing/thicker (more recently), despite lots of exercise and diet.  Always tired and feeling blah.  I am on anti-hormonals (for over a year) but of course, I start wondering about the liver.  Hate this new normal.  Recently, had a clean bone scan.  Thanks ladies! Posts.Title: Er+/Pr+/Her2 Neg and mets? duff0015 Fitztwins

Posts.Content: duff0015 wrote: Hi ladies,   I had early stage pre-menopausal bc, treated with chemo, rads, OS and an AI. My tumor marker (Ca 27-29) just went up.  I am out a year and a half.  It has fluctuated.  Yes, I know it can and I know it is can be inaccurate.  Levels are WNR.   May 07 (right after rads) - 29 Aug 07- 15 Jan 08- 14 May 08- 25 Can you please share stories about fluctuating levels and tell me is all okay!  Thanks.   Sometimes, it's good to hear. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Ca 27-29 duff0015 LuAnnH

Posts.Content: duff0015 wrote: Hi Ladies, I had a lumpectomy, chemo, rads and hormonal therapy for early stage bc.  I am almost a year out from rads.  My radiated side has gone through many changes.  It concerns me becuase it is more "lumpy" on that side making it difficult for self exams.  I just had a clear MRI.  Is this normal?  What kind of lumps are concerning versus scar tissue?   Thanks so much.       Log in to post a reply
